### Graphical tasks

This next tasks are going to ask you to make a series of figures. For each one, I would like you to make all of them *look good*. Change the theme around, change the axis labels, etc. Additionally, each of these will use the **reg** column which has 2 factors. Change the color and/or shape of them both. 

### Task 1: Continuous vs. continuous plot

Create two scatterplots of logbodysize vs. trophic_position grouped by reg

##### First plot: 
- a 2 trend lines (method = 'lm'), one for each reg variable

```{r 1.1}
#plot 1.1
ggplot(data=bloom_df,aes(x=logbodysize,y=trophic_position, color=reg)) + 
  geom_point(aes(fill=reg,shape=reg), colour = 'black', size = 3) +
  stat_smooth(method='lm', linetype='dashed', size=0.75) +
  theme_classic() +
  xlab('Log Body Size') + ylab('Trophic Position') + 
  ggtitle('Body Size vs. Trophic Position') +
  scale_fill_manual(name='Reg:',values=c('mistyrose2','cadetblue3')) + 
  scale_shape_manual(name='Reg:',values=c(21,22)) 
```

##### Second plot 
- a single trend line for the whole model

```{r 1.2}
#plot 1.2

ggplot(data=bloom_df,aes(x=logbodysize,y=trophic_position)) + 
  geom_point(aes(fill=reg,shape=reg), size = 3) +
  stat_smooth(method='lm', linetype='dashed',colour='black',size=0.75) +
  theme_classic() +
  xlab('Log Body Size') + ylab('Trophic Position') + 
  ggtitle('Body Size vs. Trophic Position') +
  scale_fill_manual(name='Reg:',values=c('mistyrose2','cadetblue3')) + 
  scale_shape_manual(name='Reg:',values=c(21,22)) 


view(bloom_df)
```

### Task 2: Continuous vs. categorical

##### The layout will be: 
- 2 panels: trophic_position and logbodysize  
- x axis: reg  
- y axis: value of trophic_position and logbodysize  

##### Create 4 plots:  
- bar and error bars (mean and 95% conf. int.)  
- point and error bars (mean and 95% conf. int.)  
- box plots  
- raw data + point and error bars (mean and 95% conf. int.)  

All these plots should have the same general layout but change the type of plot to visualize the data. 

**HINT:** logbodysize and trophic_position need to be turned into long format  

##### Example layout:   
![sample layout for task2](hw_task2_blank.png){width=50%}

```{r 2.1}
#plot 2.1

#make long format
bloom_long_df <- bloom_df %>%
  #pivot longer makes it a long format using ppt and temp in a new column called clim
  pivot_longer(cols = c(logbodysize, trophic_position), names_to = "Size_and_Position", values_to = "value")
#view(bloom_long_df)

ggplot(data=bloom_long_df,aes(x=reg,y=value,colour=Size_and_Position)) +
  facet_wrap(~Size_and_Position,nrow=1,scales = 'free') +
  stat_summary(fun.data = mean_cl_boot, geom = "errorbar") + 
  stat_summary(fun = mean, geom = "bar") +
  theme_classic() +
  xlab('Reg') + ylab('Log Body Size or Trophic Position') + 
  ggtitle(label='Log Body Size and Trophic Position')


```

```{r 2.2}
#plot 2.2

ggplot(data=bloom_long_df,aes(x=reg,y=value,colour=Size_and_Position)) +
  facet_wrap(~Size_and_Position,nrow=1,scales = 'free') +
  geom_sina(size=3) +
  stat_summary(fun.data = mean_cl_boot, geom = "errorbar",color='black') + 
  stat_summary(fun = mean, geom = "point",size=5,colour='black') +
  theme_classic() +
  xlab('Reg') + ylab('Log Body Size or Trophic Position') + 
  ggtitle(label='Log Body Size and Trophic Position')

```

### Task 3: layering your plots

Make any two figures with the bloom_df! Can be something we've done or something completely different. Make one TERRIBLE figure and one GREAT figure.

Put them together using *patchwork* or *ggarrange* 


```{r 3}
#plot 3

bad_figure <- ggplot(data=bloom_long_df,aes(x=reg,y=value,colour=Size_and_Position)) +
  geom_bar(stat='identity',position='dodge') + 
  ggtitle('Bad Figure') + 
  theme(plot.title = element_text(size = 20, colour="black",face = "bold"))
  
good_figure <- ggplot(data=bloom_long_df,aes(x=reg,y=value,colour=Size_and_Position)) +
  facet_wrap(~Size_and_Position,nrow=1,scales = 'free') +
  geom_sina(size=3) +
  stat_summary(fun.data = mean_cl_boot, geom = "errorbar",color='black') + 
  stat_summary(fun = mean, geom = "point",size=5,colour='black') +
  theme_classic() +
  xlab('Reg') + ylab('Log Body Size or Trophic Position') + 
  ggtitle(label='Good Figure')


bad_figure / good_figure

```
